result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to Count #2 but Concurrent with Count #3

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall authorize DOC to withhold 25% of all inmate monies to pay fines/costs/surcharges/restitution.  The balance due shall be a condition of extended supervision/parole.  If discharged with financial obligations owing, a civil judgment shall be entered and/or other collection procedures will be implemented.

To provide DNA Sample and pay surcharge.
To make reasonable efforts to obtain/maintain full-time employment.

Absolute sobriety.

Not to possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

No contact with M.P., or any of the victims family or their residence.

No unsupervised contact witih children under 12 years unless agent approves.

To pay supervision fees as determined by the DOC.

Counseling as recommended by agent

records.addlTxt:
Minutes - 8:36 a.m. Defendant Daniel A. Griffin in court with attorney Michael Edward O'Rourke.  Defendant Daniel A. Griffin in custody.  Eric Toney appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
*Court addresses the untimely filing of State's motions; Discussions with parties regarding next potential 7 day time block should there be a request to adjourn Jury Trial; Other Acts Motion and Motion to Preclude third person culpability,Defendant has filed a Motion to adjourn based on untimely filing of Motions and his schedule; Court grants request to adjourn those two motions to 2/11/16 at 9:30 a.m.;  Court denies Motion for Change of Venue with leave to renew should it become an issue; 9:21 a.m. Concluded.
